org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster

Class GTPClusterDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster.ClusterDriver
        • org.hps.recon.ecal.cluster.GTPClusterDriver

  • public class GTPClusterDriver
extends ClusterDriver
    Class GTPClusterDriver is an implementation of the ClusterDriver class that defines employs the readout variant of the GTP hardware clustering algorithm. Specifics on the behavior of this algorithm can be found in its documentation.

    GTPClusterDriver allows for all of the variable settings used by the GTP algorithm to be defined. It also can be set to "verbose" mode, where it will output detailed information on each event and the cluster forming process. This is disabled by default, but can be enabled for debugging purposes.

    GTPClusterDriver is designed to read from Monte Carlo data organized into 2-ns beam bunches. It can not be used for hardware readout data, or Monte Carlo formatted in this style. For this data, the GTPOnlineClusterer should be employed instead.
    See Also:
    GTPClusterer

    • Constructor Detail

      • GTPClusterDriver

        public GTPClusterDriver()
        Instantiates a new GTPClusterer, which will produce clusters using the GTP algorithm in the 2-ns beam bunch scheme. It will, by default, use a 50 MeV seed energy cut with +/- 2 a clock-cycle verification and inclusion window.

    • Method Detail

      • setLimitClusterRange

        @Deprecated
public void setLimitClusterRange(boolean limitClusterRange)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets whether the behavior of the hit inclusion window with respect to the hit verification window. If set to false, both windows will be identical in size. Otherwise, the inclusion window will be equal in size after the seed hit, but encompass only one clock-cycle before the seed hit. This should be replaced by the method setAsymmetricWindow.
        Parameters:
        limitClusterRange - - true indicates that the asymmetric window should be used and false that it should not.

      • setClusterWindow

        public void setClusterWindow(int clusterWindow)
        Sets the size of the hit verification temporal window. Note that this defines the size of the window in one direction, so the full time window will be (2 * clusterWindow) + 1 clock-cycles in length. (i.e., it will be a length of clusterWindow before the seed hit, a length of clusterWindow after the seed hit, plus the cycle that includes the seed hit.) Time length is in clock-cycles.
        Parameters:
        clusterWindow - - The number of clock-cycles around the hit in one direction.

      • setSeedEnergyThreshold

        public void setSeedEnergyThreshold(double seedEnergyThreshold)
        Sets the minimum seed energy needed for a hit to be considered for forming a cluster. This is the seed energy lower bound trigger cut and is in units of GeV.
        Parameters:
        seedEnergyThreshold - - The minimum cluster seed energy in GeV.

      • setAsymmetricWindow

        public void setAsymmetricWindow(boolean asymmetricWindow)
        Sets whether the behavior of the hit inclusion window with respect to the hit verification window. If set to false, both windows will be identical in size. Otherwise, the inclusion window will be equal in size after the seed hit, but encompass only one clock-cycle before the seed hit.
        Parameters:
        asymmetricWindow - - true indicates that the asymmetric window should be used and false that it should not.

      • setVerbose

        public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
        Sets whether the clustering algorithm should output diagnostic text or not.
        Parameters:
        verbose - - true indicates that the driver should output diagnostic text and false that it should not.

      • setWriteClusterCollection

        public void setWriteClusterCollection(boolean state)
        Defines whether the output of this clusterer should be persisted to LCIO or not. By default, this
        Overrides:
        setWriteClusterCollection in class ClusterDriver
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that clusters will be persisted, and false that they will not.
